title: Monarch Surveyors and Engineering Consultants Ltd News: Latest Monarch Surveyors and Engineering Consultants Ltd News Today on Business Standard
description: Monarch Surveyors and Engineering Consultants Ltd News: Get the latest news today on Monarch Surveyors and Engineering Consultants Ltd. Follow Business Standard for the complete news coverage and key information about the Monarch Surveyors and Engineering Consultants Ltd.
content:
Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: The Nifty index snapped its six-day winning streak on Friday after DIIs turned net sellers for 13 consecutive days of buying

Stocks to Watch today, Monday, August 25, 2025: Here is the complete list of stocks to watch during today's trading session

AB Capital, Asahi India among top stock picks for today; Check target here Aditya Birla Capital, Asahi India Glass, and Rashtriya Chemical and Fertilizers are among the top stock picks by Rajesh Bhosale of Angel One

Mangal Electrical IPO allotment status: Investors can check their status on the official websites of the NSE, BSE and Bigshare Services

The price of 22-carat gold also declined by ₹10, with ten grams of the yellow metal selling at ₹93,140

Asian stocks rally as investors bet on US rate cuts, eye Nvidia earnings Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's dovish change of course has seen futures price in an 84 per cent chance of a quarter-point rate cut in September

Meanwhile, they will offload shares worth around ₹2,500 crore and ₹2,000 crore from two-wheeler major Hero MotoCorp and IndusInd Bank on account of their removal from the 50-stock index
summary: The Nifty index saw a decline in its six-day winning streak after DIIs turned net sellers for 13 consecutive days. The price of 22-carat gold also dropped by a significant amount. The Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's change of course has led futures to an 84 per cent chance of a quarter-point rate cut in September. Meanwhile, Indian companies are set to sell shares worth around $2,000 each from two-wheeler major Hero MotoCorp and IndusInd Bank due to their removal from the 50-stock index.
shortSummary: The Nifty index ended a six-day winning streak as DIIs turned net sellers, with AB Capital, Asahi India, and Mangal Electrical IPO allotment status among the top stock picks.
argos_summary: The Sensex fell, ending a six‑day rally as DIIs sold, while the Nifty also slipped. Market watchers highlighted AB Capital, Asahi India, Aditya Birla Capital, Asahi India Glass and Rashtriya Chemical and Fertilizers as top picks for Monday, with the Mangal Electrical IPO allotment status available on NSE, BSE and Bigshare. Gold prices dropped ₹10 per gram to ₹93,140. Asian stocks rallied on expectations of U.S. rate cuts, with Fed Chair Powell’s dovish tone boosting odds of a September cut, and investors are offloading shares of Hero MotoCorp and IndusInd Bank after their removal from the 50‑stock index.
